headings: Earn a Master’s Degree at the Same Time
B.A. in English with Teacher Certification
What Can You Do With an English Degree?
Why Earn My English Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: English creates opportunities to develop career skills in communication, multicultural appreciation, critical thinking, technical writing, creative writing, teaching and business writing.

When you major in English, you will learn the problem-solving, research and analytical skills that are useful in any career field. You have the option of further specializing your degree in one of two areas, creative writing or technical and business writing. A teacher certification option is also available. No matter which specialization you choose, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to gain hands-on experience both in and out of the classroom, preparing you for your career upon graduation.
You have the option of applying for our integrated program that allows you to earn your B.A. in English and yourMaster of Arts (M.A.) in Englishdegree in as little as five years.
Our award-winning faculty work closely with students in the classroom and on individual research projects. If you earn an English degree from ASU, you’ll know your professors and they will know you.
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

Our graduates work in the U.S. and internationally in technology, government agencies, nonprofit organizations, education, finance and retail, and as creative writers, artists and small business owners.

The Natalie Zan Ryan Department of English and Modern Languages is home to the annual ASU Writers Conference in Honor of Elmer Kelton. Writers from all over the country join us on campus for an engaging two-day conference, which brings award-winning authors from all genres to share their works and creativity with the ASU and local communities.

Enhance your degree with one of our many minors! Our minors in English,Creative WritingandTechnical Writingpair great with most academic majors. Plus, we offer several scholarships specifically for students in our department. You can also gain hands-on experience helping publish our Oasis literary magazine, or as a tutor in our Writing Center.

Our department offers a variety of student organizations to help you get connected with your fellow English and modern languages students and professors. Join one (or several!) to take part in our social activities and develop your professional and networking skills.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
